definition: lovers' rendezvous/tryst
remote/hidden away/secluded/serene/peaceful/to imprison/in superstition indicates the underworld/ancient district spanning Liaonang and Hebei provinces
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Left alone with him, she entices José with suggestions of a rendezvous that night.
sentences.chinese: 在与贺塞独处时，卡门诱惑贺塞在晚上与她幽会。

sentences.english: Look at John checking Money out. Do you think he will ask her out?
sentences.chinese: 你瞧约翰在打量莫尼呢。你觉得他会约她外出幽会吗？

sentences.english: Moreover, Huang Jingao had developed secret codes with the mistresses .
sentences.chinese: 此外，黄金高还与每位情妇都商定了幽会暗号。

sentences.english: Many plans for secret meetings in the woods were hatched.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都在筹划着在林中幽会。

sentences.english: She described meeting Henry at a party in our town and how their sexual relationship began.
sentences.chinese: 然后告诉我他们在镇上的聚会上认识，接着开始幽会。

sentences.english: I came out alone on my way to my tryst.
I didn’t worry much about Nick coming home on our Tuesdays together.
sentences.chinese: 每星期二我们幽会时，我不太担心尼克会突然回家。

sentences.english: One of them wrote her a love letter, insisting upon a private meeting.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个给她写了一封情书，一定要和她幽会。

sentences.english: But their love-in is not expected to last long.
sentences.chinese: 然而，彼此之间的爱恋幽会预料将不会持续太久。

sentences.english: Did not think their tryst was seen in green.
sentences.chinese: 没想到他们的幽会却被采青看到了。

sentences.english: Meanwhile , Fran and Sheldrake meet at the apartment .
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，弗兰正和希德瑞克在巴德的公寓里幽会。

definition: to carry on a clandestine love affair
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
to catch a couple in the act (adultery, illicit sexual relations)
to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
adultery
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
illicit sexual relations
to flirt
to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to meet by accident
to meet together
lit. to rest and fly together (idiom)/fig. to live in each other's pockets/to be inseparable
lover/sweetheart
